required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacodynamic Effect of ARO-AAT
clinical_study.official_title: A Placebo-Controlled, Multi-dose, Phase 2 Study to Determine the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacodynamic Effect of ARO-AAT in Patients With Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency (AATD) [SEQUOIA]

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of AROAAT2001 (SEQUOIA) is to evaluate the safety, efficacy and tolerability of multiple doses of the investigational product, ARO-AAT, administered subcutaneously to participants with alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency (AATD).

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will be enrolled to receive multiple subcutaneous injections of ARO-AAT or placebo. Eligible participants will require a pre-dose biopsy completed as part of the study within the screening window. However, any participant with a biopsy result within 1 year of screening showing no fibrosis does not require a pre-dose biopsy. Only participants who have liver fibrosis will undergo a post-dose biopsy and may continue treatment in an open-label extension.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Serum Z-Alpha-1 Antitrypsin (Z-AAT)

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change from Baseline in Total Liver Z-AAT (Insoluble + Soluble) Protein at Post-dose Biopsy for Participants with Fibrosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 48 (+/- 2 Weeks), or Week 72 (+/- 4 Weeks), or Week 96 (+/- 4 Weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change from Baseline in Total Liver Z-AAT (Insoluble + Soluble) Protein at Post-dose Biopsy for Participants with Fibrosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 48 (+/- 2 Weeks), or Week 72 (+/- 4 Weeks), or Week 96 (+/- 4 Weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change from Baseline in Liver Z-AAT Soluble Protein at Post-dose Biopsy for Participants with Fibrosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 48 (+/- 2 Weeks), or Week 72 (+/- 4 Weeks), or Week 96 (+/- 4 Weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change from Baseline in Liver Z-AAT Soluble Protein at Post-dose Biopsy for Participants with Fibrosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 48 (+/- 2 Weeks), or Week 72 (+/- 4 Weeks), or Week 96 (+/- 4 Weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change from Baseline in Liver Z-AAT Insoluble Protein at Post-dose Biopsy for Participants with Fibrosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 48 (+/- 2 Weeks), or Week 72 (+/- 4 Weeks), or Week 96 (+/- 4 Weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change from Baseline in Liver Z-AAT Insoluble Protein at Post-dose Biopsy for Participants with Fibrosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 48 (+/- 2 Weeks), or Week 72 (+/- 4 Weeks), or Week 96 (+/- 4 Weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) at Week 16 and over time through End of Study (EOS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 16 (+/- 2 weeks) through Week 64 (+/- 2 weeks) (participants without fibrosis) or Week 16 (+/- 2 weeks) through Week 172 (participants with fibrosis)

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change from Baseline in Liver Function Tests: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT), Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST), Alkaline Phosphatase (ALP), Gamma-Glutamyl Transferase (GGT) at Week 16 and over time through EOS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 16 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants Without Fibrosis: through Week 64 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants With Fibrosis: through Week 172

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change from Baseline in Liver Function Tests: ALT, AST, ALP, GGT at Week 16 and over time through EOS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 16 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants Without Fibrosis: through Week 64 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants With Fibrosis: through Week 172

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change from Baseline in Liver Function Tests: Total Bilirubin, Direct Bilirubin at Week 16 and over time through EOS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 16 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants Without Fibrosis: through Week 64 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants With Fibrosis: through Week 172

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change from Baseline in Liver Function Tests: Total Bilirubin, Direct Bilirubin at Week 16 and over time through EOS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 16 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants Without Fibrosis: through Week 64 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants With Fibrosis: through Week 172

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change from Baseline in Liver Function Tests: International Normalized Ratio (INR) at Week 16 and over time through EOS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 16 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants Without Fibrosis: through Week 64 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants With Fibrosis: through Week 172

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change from Baseline in Liver Function Tests: INR at Week 16 and over time through EOS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 16 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants Without Fibrosis: through Week 64 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants With Fibrosis: through Week 172

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in Serum Z-AAT Over Time through EOS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Participants Without Fibrosis: through Week 64 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants With Fibrosis: through Week 172

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Serum Z-AAT Over Time through EOS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Participants Without Fibrosis: through Week 64 (+/- 2 Weeks), Participants With Fibrosis: through Week 172

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK) of ARO-AAT: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants Without Fibrosis: Pre-dose, 1 hour, 2 hour & 24 or 48 hours post-dose on Day 1 (+/- 1 Day); Participants with Fibrosis: Pre-dose, 1 hour, 2 hours & 24 or 48 hours post-dose on Days 1 and 113 (+/- 1 Day)

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of ARO-AAT: Time to Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants Without Fibrosis: Pre-dose, 1 hour, 2 hour & 24 or 48 hours post-dose on Day 1 (+/- 1 Day); Participants with Fibrosis: Pre-dose, 1 hour, 2 hours & 24 or 48 hours post-dose on Days 1 and 113 (+/- 1 Day)

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of ARO-AAT: Terminal Elimination Half-Life (t1/2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants Without Fibrosis: Pre-dose, 1 hour, 2 hours & 24 or 48 hours post-dose on Day 1 (+/- 1 Day); Participants with Fibrosis: Pre-dose, 1 hour, 2 hours & 24 or 48 hours post-dose on Days 1 and 113 (+/- 1 Day)

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of ARO-AAT: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve from Zero to the Last Time Point with a Quantifiable Concentration (AUC0-t)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants Without Fibrosis: Pre-dose, 1 hour, 2 hour & 24 or 48 hours post-dose on Day 1 (+/- 1 Day); Participants with Fibrosis: Pre-dose, 1 hour, 2 hours & 24 or 48 hours post-dose on Days 1 and 113 (+/- 1 Day)

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of ARO-AAT: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve from Zero to Infinity (AUCinf)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants Without Fibrosis: Pre-dose, 1 hour, 2 hour & 24 or 48 hours post-dose on Day 1 (+/- 1 Day); Participants with Fibrosis: Pre-dose, 1 hour, 2 hours & 24 or 48 hours post-dose on Days 1 and 113 (+/- 1 Day)

arm_group.description: Participants with no fibrosis: Administered on Day 1 and Week 4 Participants with fibrosis: Administered on Day 1, Week 4, and Week 16, then every 12 weeks up to 15 total doses.
Participants with no fibrosis: Administered on Day 1 and Week 4 Participants with fibrosis: Administered on Day 1, Week 4, and Week 16, then every 12 weeks up to 15 total doses.

intervention.description: sterile normal saline (0.9% NaCl), calculated to match active comparator, for sc injection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of AATD
- Liver biopsy at Screening indicating liver fibrosis (score less than F4); a patient with no fibrosis may participate based on a previous biopsy conducted within one year
- Women of childbearing potential must have a negative pregnancy test, cannot be breastfeeding, and must be willing to use contraception
- Willing to provide written informed consent and to comply with study requirements
- Non-smoker for at least 1 year
- No abnormal finding of clinical relevance at Screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically significant health concerns other than AATD
- Previous diagnosis or diagnosis at Screening of definitive liver cirrhosis
- Previous lung or liver transplant due to AATD
- Regular use of alcohol within one month prior to Screening
- Use of an investigational agent or device within 30 days prior to dosing or current participation in an investigational study involving therapeutic intervention
- Use of illicit drugs within 1 year prior to Screening
NOTE: additional inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply, per protocol
